text: (upbeat music)
- [Narrator] In Formula One,
it's the split seconds that count.

Squeezing that extra
thousandth out of the track

can be the difference between
starting from pole position

or having to fight your
way through the path.
(upbeat music)
But until now, we've been unable to see

where on the track the fastest
cars are making their gains

and where the rest are
leaving time on the table.
Introducing Track Dominance,
a new F1 Insight powered by AWS.
(upbeat music)

An advanced algorithm
takes live timing data
gathered from more than 20 sensors
embedded all around the track
and calculates how quickly each driver
has passed between them
before using this data
to compare how two different drivers
have attacked the whole circuit.

A TV graphic shows an
outline of the track;
splits it into low, medium,
and high speed corners and straights;

and reveals where a driver
is dominating his rivals
around the track.

Using this new insight,
we'll be able to see

who's making all their
time through the corners,
who's powering away on the straights,

and exerting their track
dominance over the weekend.
F1 Insights powered by AWS.
